definition: one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

sentences.english: You could put half of Trump"s supporters into what I call the basket of deplorables."
sentences.chinese: 特朗普的半数支持者都是‘一箩筐可怜虫’。

sentences.english: Although my grandmother was illiterate, she had a good stack of myths and legends.
sentences.chinese: 我的祖母不识字，可是她有一箩筐的神话和传奇故事。

sentences.english: Jenkins then found a case of beer strapped to the lawnmower 's front, court records show.
sentences.chinese: 简金斯发现，锄草机正前方捆绑著一箩筐的啤酒。

sentences.english: He has a lot of girlfriends and is a bit of a heartbreaker.
sentences.chinese: 他女朋友有一箩筐，有点算是万人迷了。

sentences.english: The storefront at the Shu Jen bookstore looks unassuming enough, but the owner has a basketful of stories.
sentences.chinese: 树人书店的门面看来不怎样，主人却有一箩筐故事。

definition: friendly advice/words spoken on sb's behalf/a good word/kind words/words that sound fine but are not followed up with actions
lit. stale grain, overcooked sesame (idiom); fig. the same boring old gossip
pinyin: chen2 gu3 zi5 lan4 zhi1 ma5

definition: an assortment/a bit of everything/lots of different (skills)
everything in disorder (idiom)/in a hideous mess/obscene/dirty/filthy
polite phrase/conventional greetings/cliché/to try to worm facts out of sb
three (colloquial equivalent of 三個|三个)
dialectal equivalent of 什麼|什么[shen2 me5]/also pr. [sha4]
